content: all in one fish - amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are a few lovely fish patterns out there already but some of them take quite some time to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30-40 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work i usually work this pattern with two strands of yarn but it works perfectly with one strand you can have a plain fish or just change the colours of the fins and tail or have it multi-coloured throughout it is very versatile as you can use any yarn and any ply my pattern contains basic instructions meant for someone who is already familiar crocheting amigurumi stitches chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase increase decrease decrease picot three chain and slip stitch into the back of the first chain optional criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one---fish instructions body for my example piece in the pictures i have used two strands of yarn and change one strand to an alternative colour for the colour changes you can use one strand throughout or use two and change any strand of colour whenever you chose the pattern listed below has the fish s colour changes in the same place as my photos row 1 using the main / plain colour single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring 6 stitches one thing i like doing with the pattern is not pulling the magic_ring super tight if you leave a hole in the middle it looks just like a fish s mouth row 2 *increase in each single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 single_crochet 12 12 stitches row 4 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 5 single_crochet 18 18 stitches row 6 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2 * repeat around 24 stitches row 7 single_crochet 24 24 stitches row 8-9 change colour to alternative colour single_crochet 24 24 stitches row 10 single_crochet 4 increase in next stitch complete fin by crocheting all the stitches in brackets into the front loop of the next stitch slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 3 dc3 chain 3 slip_stitch back into the front loop of the same stitch increase in next stitch single_crochet 10 increase in next stitch complete fin slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 3 dc3 chain 3 slip_stitch back into the same stitch increase in next stitch single_crochet 4 28 stitches summary single_crochet 4 increase fin increase single_crochet 10 increase fin increase single_crochet 4 = 28 stitches row 11 single_crochet 5 decrease behind the fin miss the back stitch from the row before
